page.title: 12LOCAL FOLKLORE/SUPERSTITION
page.content: During the reign of Henry VIII, when all the monasteries were ransacked and closed, a monk from a monastery sited near to where the Hemlock campsite now stands, was beheaded. He is said to roam the campsite at night searching for his head so that he can rest in peace. The monk has been sighted on several occasions by reliable people. The Hemlock Stone has been the site of Devil Worship and Black Magic rites throughout the centuries. An old lady dressed in her white bed gown, rocking in her chair has also been sighted near the Hemlock camp.
